author: redbeardlegoman
title: My...My Freeze Collar! I'm dying!
review:
A must have if you want your Super Heroes minifigs to be complete, and the perfect compliment to your 76052 Batman Classic TV Series Batcave.

Box/Instructions

The polybag is normally something that I open and toss.  But because this one has the iconic Batman series logo, and the fabulous "ZZZZZWAP!" effect, it's a keeper.

The instructions are ... well, instructions.  No departure from usual polybag directions.

Parts

The parts are fun.  The freeze gun and backpack have all the over-done charm of 1960's science fiction.  Big.  Bulky.  The absolute opposite of slick and elegant.  And, there are like five or six extra pieces, including a wind-up key.  Not bad for a small part count set.

Minifigures

Otto Preminger is totally reborn in this fun little figure.  It's got the three dials from his freeze collar, and the print is carried over onto the back.  And those eyebrows!  Oh, those lovely, bushy eyebrows!  Attention to detail on par with Ceasar Romero's makeup-covered moustache.  This is real love for fans right here.

The build

You get more build than you typically do in polybag minifigures.  The gun doesn't exactly attach to the pack.  It's connected by the hose, but the back of the blue stock seems like it really should be hooked to something.  But that's only a minor fault, and hardly a deal-breaker.

The completed model

He just looks so fabulous mingled in on my shelf with the rest of the Rogues Gallery.  

Overall opinion

I knew I had to have this once I saw the first picture, and I'm so glad I managed to add him to my collection.

This is a great value for a polybag minifigure.  It's a lovely homage to a camp classic.  No true nerd is complete without it.

Get it now before the resale value goes through the roof.  If you have the 76052 Batcave, you simply MUST have Mr. Freeze.

author: Odeinoichus
title: WHAM, POW! It's Classic Mr. Freeze, Batman.
review:
Set #30603 Batman Classic TV Series Mr. Freeze: One of the longest names for an official Polybag out there, this little gem was a free giveaway last year from LEGO S&H and it was a brilliant decision to make him available.

Mr. Freeze represents the version as seen in the Adam West 1960's era Television Series, as such he's a bit more campy looking compared to the other Mr. Freeze minifigures we've gotten. His torso is double-sided with a nice print that shows the jumpsuit he mostly wore with some extra tech detailing around the neck for where his cooling unit was kept. He has no helmet, just a simple cooling unit so you can see his face, which includes large bushy eyebrows... for the life of me I can't recall the original actor's name.

Unique to this Free Minifigure is a buildable freeze gun with back bracket for mounting, it's a clever little build that features a wind-up key and some antifreeze canisters or something to launch concentrated freeze rays at Batman. It's been a long time since I saw the television series so I can't recall the original interpretation before Paul Dini and friends changed up his origins in the 90's, either way this is a fun little build using some clever techniques to make it resemble something you'd find on the set of a 1960's television production. Very low tech.

He's a great figure and I'd recommend tracking this beauty down if you missed it the first time, it'll go great with the Classic Series Batcave as an extra villain. Highly recommended.
